content:
The phrase "Multiple followed by the number" is very misleading and unclear. It implies it could be the number of colors tied for first place or the total count of votes for all the numbers tied for first place. When playing I didn't even think that it could mean the number of votes at which the tie occurred.

Edited description to better reflect that.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice, short and easy CoC. Challenging for shortest, I think.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Cool problem

Fun, not too long and simple

My solution was:

n = int(input())

dups = {}
t = [input() for _ in range(n)]

for i in t:
    if i not in dups:
        dups[i] = 0
    dups[i] += 1

num = max(dups.items(), key=lambda k: k[1])[1]
color = [i for i in dups if dups[i]==num]

print(f"{color[0]} {num}" if len(color) < 2 else f"Multiple {num}")

Suggest you to rewrite as follows:

Input section:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of people who answered the poll.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> The most liked colours, one reply (colour) per line.

Output section:
One line: The most liked colour followed by the number of people who liked it.
If more than 1 colour share the top ranking, output "Multiple" followed by the number.
Yup it feels better like that, thank you c:

Cheater. I saw you re-use this exact code in a clash just now to win Reverse Mode in 1 minute 4 seconds.
https://www.codingame.com/clashofcode/clash/report/2327848d0c27e9af2219d14cfd578107e917ad5

Don't re-use code please. Play each clash with your coding skills, not your copy+paste skills.
